de.polygonal.ds.Array3

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A three-dimensional array.

Constructor

new(w : Int, h : Int, d : Int)
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid width, height or depth(if debug flag is set).
Creates a three-dimensional array with width w, height h and depth d (minimum size is 2x2x1).

Instance Methods

assign(x : Dynamic, ?args : Array<Dynamic>) : Void

parameters
x If x is a class reference, the three-dimensional array is filled with instances of the specified class and the args parameter is used to pass additional constructor arguments. If x is an object or a primitive value, the object reference or the value of x is assigned instead.
Assigns new content to the three-dimensional array by replacing elements with x.

clear() : Void

Clears all elements by creating a new underlying array.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this three-dimensional array.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this three-dimensional array contains the element x.

get(x : Int, y : Int, z : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Returns the value stored at column x, row y and layer z.

getArray() : Array<T>

Grants access to the linear Array storing the values of the three-dimensional array. Useful for advanced low-level operations.

getCol(z : Int, x : Int, output : Array<T>) : Void

returns
The output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or output is null (if debug flag is set).
Pushes the values stored in the column/layer x,z to output.

getD() : Int

The depth (#layers).

getH() : Int

The height (#rows).

getLayer(z : Int, output : Array2<T>) : Array2<T>

returns
A reference to output.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid layer or output is null or output too small (if debug flag is set).
Extracts a 'slice' from the three-dimensional array and stores the elements in output.

getPile(x : Int, y : Int, output : Array<T>) : Void

returns
The output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or output is null (if debug flag is set).
Pushes the values from all layers at row/column y,x to output.

getRow(z : Int, y : Int, output : Array<T>) : Void

returns
A reference to output.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or output is null (if debug flag is set).
Pushes the values stored in the row y and layer z to output.

getW() : Int

The width (#columns).

isEmpty() : Bool

Always returns false.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all values in this three-dimensional array.

resize(w : Int, h : Int, d : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid dimensions (if debug flag is set).
Sets the width w, height h and depth d of the three-dimensional array (minimum size is 2x2x1). If the new size is smaller than the existing size, values are lost because of truncation.

set(x : Int, y : Int, z : Int, val : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Writes val into the cell at column x, row y and layer z.

setCol(z : Int, x : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or input is null or insufficient input values (if debug flag is set).
Copies values from input in the range [0,getH()] to the column at index x, layer z.

setD(d : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid depth (if debug flag is set).
Sets a new depth. The minimum value is 1.

setH(h : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid height (if debug flag is set).
Sets a new height. The minimum value is 2.

setPile(x : Int, y : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or input is null or insufficient input values (if debug flag is set).
Copies values from input in the range [0,getD()] to all layers at row y, column x.

setRow(z : Int, y : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or input is null or insufficient input values (if debug flag is set).
Copies the values from input in the range [0,getW()] to the row at index y, layer z.

setW(w : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid width (if debug flag is set).
Sets a new width. The minimum value is 2.

shuffle(?rval : Vector<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval A list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError rval is null or insufficient random values (if debug flag is set).
Shuffles the elements of this three-dimensional array using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. If rval is not given, Math.random() is used, otherwise random values are taken from the specified rval array.

size() : Int

The total size of this three-dimensional array, equals getW()*getH()*getD().

swap(x0 : Int, y0 : Int, z0 : Int, x1 : Int, y1 : Int, z1 : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or x0,y0,z0 equals x1,y1,z1 (if debug flag is set).(if debug flag is set).
Swaps the value stored at x0,y0,z0 with the value stored at x1,y1,z1.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array layer by layer, row by row. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector layer by layer, row by row. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.

walk(process : T -> Int -> Int -> Int -> T) : Void

Invokes the specified process function on each element. The function signature is: process(oldValue, x-index, y-index, z-index):newValue
